document.docAuthor: Ornosa, Concepción, Torres, Félix & Rúa, Pilar De La
document.masterDocTitle: Updated list of bumblebees (Hymenoptera: Apidae) from the Spanish Pyrenees with notes on their decline and conservation status

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updated list of bumblebees (Hymenoptera: Apidae) from the Spanish Pyrenees with notes on their decline and conservation status

subSubSection.paragraph:
The Iberian subspecies occurs in alpine pastures from the Pyrenees and Cantabrian Range between 1100 and 2000 meters high ( Ornosa & Ortiz-Sánchez 2004 ,
Herrera et al. 2014
); currently it has been collected between 1650 and 2050 meters height ( Fig. 7 ), in temperate forest, upperforest and alpine grasslands and shrublands, open areas in coniferous forests of
Pinus uncinata Ram
, with
Abies alba Mill
and scattered patches of subalpine shrub of
Juniperus comunis nana Willd.
,
Rhododendron ferrugineum
L., and
Calluna vulgaris
(L.) Hull., foraging on
Aconitum vulparia Reich.
,
Centaurea scabiosa
L.,
Echium vulgare L.
,
Eryngium bourgatii Gouan.
,
Lathyrus occidentalis (Fisch and C. A. Mey.)
,
Lotus corniculatus L., Onobrichis vicifolia
Scop.,
Phlomis lychnitis
L. and
Trifolium repens L.

New records. Spain : Girona :
Nùria , 10-
VII-2015, 1
worker, C. Ornosa leg., UCME
;
Nùria ,
Bosc de la Verge
, 24-
VII-2009, 1
worker, C. Ornosa leg., UCME
;
La
Molina, Roc Blanco
, 25-
VII-2009, 1
worker, C. Ornosa leg., UCME .
Huesca
: Ordesa , Gradas de Soaso , 4
- VII-2006, 1 worker; 10- VII-2013, 1 queen; C. Ornosa leg., UCME; 8- VIII-2014, 2 queens, E. Acosta leg., UMU. Lleida : Baños de Tredós, 10- VII-2014, 1 queen; C. Ornosa leg., UCME.

caption.paragraph: TABLE 2. Bumblebee species and subspecies collected in the Pyrenees and IUCN category ranks (from Spain: Verdú & Galante (2006), Verdú et al. (2011) and from Europe: Rasmont et al. (2015): Not Evaluated, NE; Endangered, EN; Vulnerable, VU; Data Deficient, DD; Least Concern, LC) of the extant bumblebee species and subspecies in the Pyrenees. The number of individuals sampled between 2006 and 2015 is indicated. In rare species and those with relevant records, the number of individuals known from historical literature or collections is included in brackets.

tr.th: N° of collected individuals in the Pyrenees (2006–2015)

subSubSection.paragraph:
*Thirteen
B. mucidus mollis
individuals were sampled between 1970–1998 and 41 before 1950.
